intro: Cedrela montana var. mexicana, commonly known as Mexican yellow cedar, is a species of small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by winged fruits. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and durable wood, it is sometimes cultivated for landscaping and timber purposes.
